thread.title: 'Brexit is a monstrosity': Pro-EU float mocking Tory MPs paraded in Newcastle

author: Kathryn Riddell
title: 'Brexit is a monstrosity': Pro-EU float mocking Tory MPs paraded in Newcastle
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Prime Minister Theresa May and three of her senior MPs gate crashed an anti-Brexit rally held in Newcastle. 
This wasn’t the real Theresa May though, but a grotesque caricature mocking Brexit. 
A float entitled ‘Brexit is a Monstrosity’ was paraded past the Monument during the pro-EU protest on Sunday afternoon. 'Brexit is a monstrosity' float in Newcastle (Image: ncjMedia) 
The contorted artwork depicts a hideous mash-up of Theresa May, Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson, Environment Secretary Michael Gove and Brexit minister David Davis. 
Johnson, Gove and Davis all campaigned for Leave prior to the 2016 EU Referendum and Theresa May has vowed to lead the country through the withdrawal from the European Union. 
The four Tories appear naked on the float, aside from Mrs May’s Union Jack bra, and have jumbled-up arms and legs. Read More 
The float, which was created by campaigning group Stop Brexit, was first unveiled outside of the Tory party conference in Manchester in October. 
Campaigners parked the float near to the Theatre Royal during the anti-Brexit demonstration. Read More Fury over decision to manufacture post-Brexit blue passports in France - what our MPs are saying 
Brian Paddick, ex-Lib Dem London Mayor candidate and Lord Andrew Adonis were two of the speakers who addressed the crowd of around 200 people during the rally. 
The UK is due to leave the EU on March 29, 2019 with a transition period until the end of 2020. Like us on Facebook
